She heavily favors a few books (Job, John, and Matthew) and refers more than once to only a few texts. Reynaert gives a handy chart of his conclusions regarding her biblical references in Reynaert 1981, 411-13, and also lists and briefly analyzes her more sustained paraphrases and commentaries

Nor, for that matter, does Hadewijch make much use of the Song of Songs itself. Reynaert identifies perhaps 25 references, but eleven of these are to a single verse, 2:16 ("delectus meus mihi et ego iIli"); she refers to only six other verses
